channel.title: Welcome to Aditya Rao's Portfolio on
channel.description: Recent content in Welcome to Aditya Rao's Portfolio on

item.title: Custom Firmware and iOS Integration for Medical Implants
item.description:
This project explored the use of wireless power transfer to address the limitations of wired systems in wearable and implantable medical devices. The goal was to enable real-time energy delivery and data communication, advancing the potential for seamless integration into healthcare applications.

Key Contributions:

  • Firmware Development: Designed custom firmware that implemented a novel NFC protocol for real-time communication and energy transfer.
  • iOS Application: Developed a custom app to interface with the hardware, ensuring intuitive control and data visualization.
  • Prototyping: Worked closely with hardware teams to test and refine the integrated system for consistent performance.

Impact:

  • Achieved real-time wireless power transfer and data communication for implantable devices.
  • Demonstrated the feasibility of integrating energy-efficient systems into healthcare technology.
  • Advanced the scope of wearable medical devices by addressing critical power and communication challenges.

Here is a brief video demonstrating the app capabilities. Note that the app is for use with medical devices, but in the video for development purposes, we show light and temperature sensors in place of biosensors.

item.title: Latency Analysis for Lunar Lander Test Bed
item.description:
This project tackled the critical challenge of achieving precise sub-millisecond latency measurements within the Lunar Lander Test Bed, essential for maintaining reliable data synchronization during mission-critical operations. The innovative methods developed met the stringent performance criteria of lunar exploration.

Key Contributions:

  • Methodology Development: Designed and implemented a novel loopback testing method to synchronize time sources effectively, overcoming both hardware and software limitations.
  • Validation: Conducted comprehensive oscilloscope testing and software simulations to ensure precision and consistency across various scenarios.
  • Team Collaboration: Worked closely with engineers and test operators to integrate the solution into broader lunar lander systems.

Impact:

  • Achieved precise latency measurements with 1.66-millisecond accuracy, surpassing initial targets.
  • Enhanced data synchronization reliability across lunar lander systems, contributing to mission success.
  • Demonstrated the scalability of the loopback testing method for other aerospace applications.

item.title: Sample blog content 3
item.description:
Sample blog content. Like a lorem ipsum but saying something more interesting.

Welcome to the world of “Content Ipsum,” the fresh alternative to the classic lorem ipsum. It’s the perfect blend for designers and writers who crave a dash of creativity and meaning in their placeholder text. Imagine a text that not only fills the space but also sparks the imagination, a text that weaves tales of innovation, inspiration, and the endless possibilities that creativity brings.

item.title: Automation for High-Fidelity Hardware Testing
item.description:
The project involved designing and implementing Autotest drivers to streamline hardware testing processes, ensuring precision, reliability, and scalability for Falcon rocket components under demanding conditions. A critical aspect was automating sensor calibration to maintain the integrity of real-time data across extended testing cycles.

Key Contributions:

  • Developed reusable drivers that automated communication with sensors and lab hardware, ensuring seamless integration and scalability.
  • Implemented automation of sensor calibration processes, eliminating manual adjustments and ensuring consistent data accuracy.
  • Enabled real-time data streaming for 1000-hour testing cycles, significantly reducing manual oversight while improving test reliability.

Impact:

  • Reduced manual testing efforts by 30% through calibration automation, enhancing efficiency across teams.
  • Delivered scalable solutions that were adopted for testing other rocket systems, demonstrating the reusability and reliability of the drivers.
  • Maintained precision across extended testing durations by automating critical calibration tasks.
  • Enhanced system reliability through robust automation, contributing to mission-critical hardware validation.

item.title: Real-Time Telemetry System for Lunar Missions
item.description:
The Iris Lunar Rover project aimed to design advanced mission-critical systems for lunar exploration, emphasizing reliability and performance in harsh, remote environments. As part of the mission, I developed a real-time telemetry system to monitor the roverâ€™s health and predict potential failures during critical operations.

Key Contributions:

  • Telemetry Interface Design: Created a front-end system providing real-time data insights for quick diagnostics and informed decision-making during missions.
  • Predictive Failure Analysis: Developed algorithms to forecast subsystem malfunctions, reducing downtime risks.
  • Software-Hardware Integration: Collaborated with a multidisciplinary team to ensure seamless communication and data processing.

Impact:

  • Reliability: Achieved 95% system reliability in monitoring critical subsystems.
  • Operational Safety: Enhanced operational safety by identifying and addressing potential disruptions preemptively.
  • Scalability: Established a scalable telemetry framework adaptable for future planetary missions.
